description.text: On this lobby card for the movie "Shree 420", released in 1955, Raj Kapoor, one of the leading actors as well as the director, can be seen standing next to a beggar. The beggar puts his begging bowl toward Raj Kapoor asking for alms while Raj Kapoor pulls out the pocket of his pants to show him that it's empty. They stand in a crowded street.
The image is put under a plastic cover.

inscription.text: R.K. Studio Films. Shree 420. Directed by: Raj Kapoor.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

description-en: On this lobby card for the movie "Shree 420", released in 1955, Raj Kapoor, one of the leading actors as well as the director, can be seen standing next to a beggar. The beggar puts his begging bowl toward Raj Kapoor asking for alms while Raj Kapoor pulls out the pocket of his pants to show him that it's empty. They stand in a crowded street. (gs/sp)
description-en: The image is put under a plastic cover. (sg)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Storyline of the movie: Wearing torn Japanese shoes, English trousers, a red Russian cap, and a Hindustani heart, orphaned Ranbir Raj comes to Bombay to make his fortune. He pawns his gold medal, gambles with the money, loses everything, & the balance is pick-pocketed. He ends up on the beach, meets with Vidya Shastri, a teacher who runs a private school, and both fall in love. Ranbir gets a job in a laundry. When he goes to deliver some clothes to Maya, she notices that he has a way with cards, gets him to accompany her to a casino of sorts, where he wins Rs.20000/-, which unfortunately is pocketed by Maya. Then a rich industrialist, Sonanand Dharmachand, approaches Ranbir, hires him to work for him, and soon Ranbir is on his way to a wealthy life. Vidya gets a first hand look at this wealthy life, and decides to break up with him. Sonachand teaches Ranbir that in order to make money one must never discriminate between the rich and poor... http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0048613/ (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0048613/, last accessed 2012-03-14, storyline, leading actors, director. (gs)

Storyline of the movie: Wearing torn Japanese shoes, English trousers, a red Russian cap, and a Hindustani heart, orphaned Ranbir Raj comes to Bombay to make his fortune. He pawns his gold medal, gambles with the money, loses everything, & the balance is pick-pocketed. He ends up on the beach, meets with Vidya Shastri, a teacher who runs a private school, and both fall in love. Ranbir gets a job in a laundry. When he goes to deliver some clothes to Maya, she notices that he has a way with cards, gets him to accompany her to a casino of sorts, where he wins Rs.20000/-, which unfortunately is pocketed by Maya. Then a rich industrialist, Sonanand Dharmachand, approaches Ranbir, hires him to work for him, and soon Ranbir is on his way to a wealthy life. Vidya gets a first hand look at this wealthy life, and decides to break up with him. Sonachand teaches Ranbir that in order to make money one must never discriminate between the rich and poor... http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0048613/
